active_learning.discussion_prompt: In small groups, debate the trade-offs of accepting residual cybersecurity risks in resource-constrained startups versus large enterprises (e.g., accepting unpatched legacy systems). How do business objectives influence acceptance criteria? Share real-world examples like post-incident risk decisions in breaches such as SolarWinds.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in Risk Management Concepts. Topic: Risk Acceptance Criteria (Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Security And Risk Management > Risk Management Concepts > Risk-Based Decision Making > Risk Acceptance Decision > Risk Acceptance Criteria). Use this to create mastery-enabling cards. INTEGRATE: - Learning Objectives: [paste the 6 objectives above]. - Scaffolding: 4 layers [paste scaffolding details]. Prerequisite: Risk basics (NIST SP 800-30). Big picture: Enables balanced investments aligning security/business. - Active Learning: Inspire cards mimicking activities (scenarios, comparisons). - Sources: NIST CSF 2.0 (Govern/Identify), ISO 31000:2018 (Clause 6.4 risk criteria), NIST SP 800-30 Rev1. Generate 24-30 flashcards per EXACT schema: JSON array of objects with front, back, type, explanation, bloom_level, scaffolding_layer, tags. Balance: Cover all objectives/layers/Bloom's; 40% Q&A/Cloze (recall/apply), 60% MCQ. Use distractor protocol strictly. Ensure university-level: precise, scenario-based, explanations reference standards/examples. Promote active recall/spaced repetition. Output ONLY the JSON array.
